inference:
A direction vector for a line is any vector that points in the same direction as the line. The slope of a line is the ratio of the rise to the run, which is the same as the ratio of the $y$-coordinate to the $x$-coordinate of any direction vector.

Thus, the direction vectors are **(A), (B), (D), (E), (G), (H)**.

Final Answer: $\boxed{\text{A, B, D, E, G, H}}$. I hope it is correct.
